intro: Declieuxia saturejoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf saturejoides, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Declieuxia saturejoides is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks.
